backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining the application submission backend with types for CareerStatus, Program, and ApplicationForm, plus functions to submit, retrieve, and list applications stored in a map.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report tracking two logo-related features: generating the Stack Teacher logo and integrating it into the site's sticky header in Layout.tsx.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Auto-generated JSON summaries of all frontend source files, describing each component, page, hook, and config file's purpose in one sentence.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS entry file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, primary, accent, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Vite/React app, setting the page title to 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator' and mounting the React root.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router setup defining all application routes (home, program landing pages, apply, about, legal pages including refund policy) under a shared Layout root route.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Marketing section highlighting the AI infrastructure job market with US/Canada salary ranges ($95K–$180K) and a no-coding-required callout.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Section listing six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, LinkedIn optimization, etc.) to justify the $2,999 program price.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Section displaying a grid of six company names (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.) where alumni have interviewed, with a disclaimer note.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Four-phase 8-month curriculum section rendered as cards, covering Tech Foundations, Cloud Engineering, Kubernetes, and AI+Cloud Integration with topics and durations.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career support services (resume rewriting, LinkedIn optimization, SQL prep, etc.) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Displays the five-phase program curriculum (SQL, Python, Data Engineering, AI Integration, BI/Visualization) as cards with topics and outcome statements.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with six common questions and answers about the Data Analytics program.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section emphasizing Data+AI as a baseline expectation, with a button linking to the /apply route.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program, listing key skill areas with icons and a CTA button linking to /apply.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity by listing required skills and displaying US salary ranges for Data Analyst, Analytics Engineer, and Data Engineer roles.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price by contrasting what it is not (self-paced videos, tutorials) versus what it includes (mentorship, projects, career support), with a CTA to apply.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Displays the program format details (8-month duration, live sessions, labs, cohort size, etc.) as icon cards with a note about selective admission.
Showcases five portfolio projects students will build (sales dashboard, marketing analytics, data pipeline, AI reporting tool, business presentation) as cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Describes the target audience for the program (business grads, MBAs, finance/marketing professionals, career switchers, etc.) with icon cards and prerequisite callouts.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Renders a section explaining why the Data Analytics program exists by displaying a grid of common problems with most data courses, each shown with an X icon.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Displays a section contrasting what the program is NOT (bootcamp, generic IT training, self-paced videos) with what it IS, using cards with X and Check icons.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, payment plans, and program differences.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Displays three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data Analytics, QA Automation) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective detail pages.
A final call-to-action section with an 'Apply Now' link and 'Schedule a Call' button, urging users to start their $100K+ career before seats fill up.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Highlights why infrastructure engineers are AI-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and emphasizing the strategic thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration skills the program builds.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: The main hero section for the infrastructure program page, featuring a headline, five core skill icons, and Apply/Download Curriculum CTAs over a background image.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: A condensed home-page FAQ accordion with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, job placement, cohort language/timezone, and differentiation from low-cost courses.
The home page hero section with a headline targeting career switchers, a subheadline about live cohorts and mentors, and Apply/Brochure CTAs over a background image.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Illustrates the three-step program process (Apply, Learn & Build, Launch) with icons and descriptions, followed by Apply and Schedule a Call CTAs.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays a section with four key impact metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a responsive grid layout.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Renders an instructor profile section highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and track record using icon cards alongside an instructor photo.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the main app layout with a sticky header (logo, nav with program dropdown, sign in/up buttons), a footer with a newsletter signup form, and an Outlet for page content.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Provides a lead capture form card where users submit their name, email, phone, and preferred call time to schedule a free admissions call, with a success confirmation state.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Shows a grid of four portfolio projects students will complete, each with an image, title, description, and a GitHub link indicator.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Displays a single pricing card at $2,999 listing all included features, an ROI callout showing average $45k salary increase, and an Apply Now CTA button.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Presents the program structure with six feature cards (duration, cohort model, limited seats, mentorship, recorded access, community) and a phase-icons image.
Lists five real-world infrastructure projects students build (cloud architecture, data pipeline, AI deployment, Kubernetes, CI/CD) with icons, descriptions, and two illustrative images.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career services (resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, interview prep, mock interviews, behavioral training, and a 60-day job plan) as a grid of icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Defines and renders a detailed 3-month curriculum breakdown with weekly topics, AI labs, and projects for the QA Automation Engineer program, organized into month-based sections with highlight and capstone indicators.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-style FAQ section with five questions covering beginner accessibility, automation coverage, AI integration, hiring outcomes, and program differentiation.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Displays a final call-to-action section urging users to apply for the next cohort, with a headline, supporting copy, and a button linking to the /apply route.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Renders the hero section for the QA program page, featuring a headline, program tagline, an AI-threat warning callout, five key skill badges, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Displays a 'Why AI-Augmented QA?' section contrasting what AI can already automate versus what the program teaches, along with US salary range cards for QA roles.
frontend/src/components/QAOutcomesSectio: Renders a 'Program Outcomes' section listing seven skills graduates will have, displayed as a two-column grid of icon-labeled cards.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Displays the program pricing section showing a $1,999 one-time investment with a side-by-side comparison of what the program is not versus what it is, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Renders the program format section listing seven structural features (duration, live sessions, projects, time commitment, cohort model, post-program support, and selective admission) as icon cards, with a note emphasizing active learning.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Renders a 'Portfolio Deliverables' section displaying six QA project deliverables (GitHub framework, API tests, CI pipeline, docs, AI workflow, capstone) as cards with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Displays a 'Who This Program Is For' section targeting QA bootcamp audiences (career switchers, graduates, international students, etc.) as icon cards with a highlighted tagline.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Renders a 'Who This Program Is For' section for the main program with six audience types shown as checkmark cards and a 'No Prior Coding Experience Required' callout.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Displays three student testimonials with quotes, avatars, names, and roles in a responsive card grid.
Presents three core program features (cohort learning, career accelerator, AI curriculum) as icon-based feature blocks with a trust tagline.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Lists five differentiators for Stack Teacher (portfolio projects, mentor cohorts, interview training, AI-native curriculum, placement coaching) as checkmark cards.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation function wrapping the backend actor call, with loading and error state, invalidating the applications query on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication state (login, logout, identity persistence) via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query hooks—`useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication`—that fetch application data from the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that sets up Tailwind directives and defines light/dark mode CSS custom properties for the design system color tokens.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider`.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Renders the About page for Stack Teacher, describing the platform's mission, service offerings, target audiences, career services, and AI-era capabilities using icon-driven cards and sections.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: Provides a multi-field application form for users to apply to one of three programs, handling form state and submission via the useApplicationForm hook, then navigating to a success page on completion.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: Displays a confirmation page after a successful application submission, outlining the three next steps (review, interview, decision) and prompting the user to return home.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the full landing page for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling hero, feature, testimonial, FAQ, and lead capture section components in a single layout.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the full landing page for the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator program by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/PrivacyPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the Privacy Policy page with a sticky header and structured prose sections covering data collection, usage, cookies, and user rights.
Composes the full landing page for the AI-Augmented QA Automation Engineer Program by assembling all relevant QA-specific section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/RefundPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the Stack Teacher Refund & Cancellation Policy page with a sticky header, back-to-home link, and detailed policy sections covering cancellation windows, partial refunds, and contact information.
frontend/src/pages/TermsOfUsePage.tsx: Renders the Stack Teacher Terms of Service page with multiple numbered sections covering terms, confidentiality, use license, and other legal provisions.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining dark mode, custom color tokens (via CSS variables), font families (Inter, Cal Sans, JetBrains Mono), extended font sizes, border radii, box shadows, and accordion animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the current project state (version 3) for the Stack Teacher website, listing existing features, a pending logo-generation and header-integration request, and image requirements for horizontal and icon-only logo variants.
